data.text: Contents
Introduction
The purpose of this document is to define a standard operating procedure for the Urgent Treatment Centre (UTC) within the hospital.
The purpose of the UTC is to provide a service for patients self-presenting to the Emergency Department with minor injuries or illness.

The approach involves the patient presenting to the main ED reception, after which they will be either streamed or triaged appropriately by ED nurses and subsequently the most appropriate pathway is followed (appendix one).
Patients will be directed to either the main Emergency Department or if clinically indicated will be sent to the UTC, ensuring all patients meet the agreed acceptance criteria.
The service will operate seven days a week on the following hours:
08.00 to midnight at Broomfield and Southend sites
08:00 - 02:00 at Basildon site
The service is primarily and solely for the purpose of treating minor injuries or minor illnesses details of criteria in (appendix two).
The Trust is committed to the provision of a service that is fair, accessible and meets the needs of all patients.
Scope
The purpose of this document is to:
Provide an overview of the operational functioning of the UTC.
This SOP applies to all patients entering ED and streamed to the UTC meeting the agreed acceptance criteria.
Provide  exclusion  and  inclusion  criteria  with  clarity  for  acceptance  criteria (appendix 2).
Definitions

table_items.text: ‘to take away' medication for patients to be discharged home with.
The systematic process of prioritising patients on arrival at the Emergency Department.
The process of allocating patients to different physical areas / services, pathways or processes, in order to improve efficiency and effectiveness in the Emergency Department.

data.text: Role and responsibilities within the Trust
4.1.1 All members of the UTC team are individually responsible to ensure they are familiar with this SOP and the clinical and operational application of it.
4.1.2 The ED clinical lead within the directorate and the lead nurse are responsible to ensure the correct implementation of this SOP, with daily support provided by the EPIC.
Urgent Treatment Centre Clinicians:
4.2.1  The UTC Clinician may be a GP, ENP, ECP, or ED trainees ST3:

The UTC clinician is responsible for patient care from arrival via ED triage to discharge, where appropriate this will include prescribing TTA medications. They are responsible for referring patients to the respective specialty teams when clinical need arises or is indicated.

Specifically UTC Clinicians will Work as UTC clinicians; accept undifferentiated minor illness patients above the age of 12 months, and minor injury patients above the age of 1 year old, streamed by the front door triage team based in the ED, whose condition is within the inclusion criteria.
ENP are responsible for the assessment and management of patients (adult and children) presenting with injuries and minor illnesses based on individual competencies
GPs are responsible for the assessment and management of patients (adult and children) presenting with illnesses
To see and independently manage the patient autonomously, should the patient require assessment by a specialty team then referral to be made through the trusts accepted process.

Ensure that all patients and attendance details are recorded onto Lorenzo (Broomfield site), Medway ( Basildon and Southend sites) and ED patient attendance cards, including documentation regarding reasons for patient attendance, clinical examination findings and any discharge summaries, in line with trust policies (available on the intranet)

Safeguarding should be undertaken prior to streaming to UTC, and appropriate management and escalation to NIC/EPIC of ED where concerns are highlighted. Redirection will not occur where safeguarding concerns remain unresolved.
SystmOne should be reviewed for all patients where concerns are raised.
Ensure patients are seen in time order, except where clinical need indicates otherwise and operate within the four hour access standards.
Ensure that all checks and compliance are undertaken in accordance with management and trust guidance.
Paediatric Nurse:
Responsible for ensuring all checks and compliance is carried out in line with management and Trust guidance prior to the patient transferring to the UTC.
SystmOne safeguarding checks to be completed as per safeguarding policy after triage
Health Care Support Workers:
To support with transfers of patients to wards and X-ray department.
Undertake cannulation; obtain bloods and urine samples as required for speciality patients prior to transfer to speciality assessment areas.
Assist with unit daily check and escalate any concerns.
Assist with patient flow through the unit, highlighting concerns to nursing staff.
Reception Staff:
To be responsible for enabling access and greeting patients as they arrive at the unit and ensuring that they enter the correct waiting area.
To actively inform clinical team if concerned regarding any patient within the unit.
Provide information for patients/carers receiving care within the Unit, directly any concerns to the clinical team were necessary.
EPIC:
To provide senior clinical support and guidance to the clinical staff within the Unit, including the management of patient incorrectly streamed to the unit.
Paediatric Registrar:
The UTC can contact paediatric registrar on call for advice, guidance and referrals, on bleep number #6555 3250.
Lead ENP:
To ensure ongoing training and support for staff.
To ensure that the unit is audited and that performance is monitored and managed.
Ensure staffing rota is completed, providing safe levels of clinical cover.
Clinical deterioration and escalation process
Staff member to place a 2222 call stating adult/paediatric cardiac arrest (as appropriate) and giving location as
The UTC A206, Level 2, PFI at Broomfield site
Ground floor next to ED; Basildon and Southend
If the unit staff have any concerns which do not represent an immediate risk of deterioration or threat to life, they should first contact the ED EPIC.

If the unit staff and EPIC decide it is in the best interests for the patient's safety that they are to be returned to the ED following assessment by a UTC clinician, then this decision should be discussed with the EPIC.
The NIC of ED should be made aware of any patient returned from UTC to ED to identify suitable area.
Investigations
The unit will have access to the following bedside investigations:
Urine analysis/ BHCG
ECG
Should a patient who is referred to speciality require further investigations, they will be undertaken at the unit prior to transfer.
The unit will have access to radiology as required.
Admission and transfer
All patients requiring admission or speciality input the following steps needs to be followed:
Liaising with the appropriate speciality;
Complete all required investigation;
Complete time critical treatments;
Request a bed through Teletracking;
Complete SBAR handover in the ED notes;
Transfer the patient to the destination ward/ unit as per hospital transfer policy.
Discharge
Discharge will occur following completion of the patient's consultation:
E-discharge will be completed by the UTC clinician on Lorenzo or Medway;
The GP will receive one discharge summary which will be generated from Lorenzo or Medway.
Pathway/capacity escalation

Should there be any operation concerns relating to flow, increased capacity, excess waiting times or management of the UTC, escalation should occur to the ED EPIC and NIC, to enable a review of patient flow and numbers.
If patients numbers within the department remain high and unable to support social distancing to refer to the overcrowding policy.
Staffing model

Training requirements to be identified and training implemented to support and ensure staff are fully informed with roles and responsibilities and any specific or non-specific clinical education requirements identified and addressed through the Trusts extensive training and development service. This document will be available for all staff.
Staffing of the UTC will be:
Reception cover 08.00am to 00.00
ENP/ECP cover 08.00 to 00.00 utilising a combination of shifts
GP cover 12:00 to 22:00 (Mid) 08:00 – midnight ( SH)
Health Care Support Worker cover 08:00 to 00:00 (Mid)
RN x1 08:00 - midnight (SH).
Drug stock list
An appropriate stock list of medications to be administered in the UTC or supplied to patients by the clinical staff will be maintained by the ENP/ECP team and the lead pharmacist for ED.
The ENP/ECP team will be responsible for assessing stock levels twice weekly and completing the required pharmacy stock request form to pharmacy stores when required.
All qualified clinical staff hold responsibility to ensure safe storage of medications in accordance with trust policy.

Areas of drug storage must have temperature monitoring as per trust guidelines. Daily monitoring of drug fridge and room temperatures must be recorded and appropriate action undertaken if out of range.
Prescribing and administration of medicines
Qualified clinical staff must abide by all Trust policies relating to medicines.
Nursing staff, ENPs or ECPs who are not registered independent prescribers must only administer and supply medications in accordance with local PGDs available.

Clinical staff who are independent prescribers should abide by their individually agreed scope of practice, trust formulary and trust guidance available on the intranet for condition specific treatment.
Should IV medications be required then this can be prescribed by the GP and administered by the nursing and ENP staff (only in adults).
IV medication should be administered as per trust medication administration policy.
Hospital prescriptions will be stored securely, in a locked cupboard to ensure compliance.
Medications available over the counter will not be prescribed.
Out of hours TTA packs should be used when available.
IT
All patients will be booked on Lorenzo or Medway.
All episodes will be coded and discharged on Lorenzo or Medway.
GPs will have full access to Lorenzo and System –1
GPs will be using System – 1 for documentation purposes (see appendix 4)

SystmOne will be the main system for the GP's to record patient information. Lorenzo system access and inputting of information will still be required to as part of departmental patient management system to ensure ED times are recorded for performance and quality measurement purposes.

Once the patient has been seen and SystmOne updated the patient record will be printed from Systm1 and attached to the hard copy of the MSE patient record card (CAS  card).  Once  submitted,  MSE  will  be  responsible  for  the  record  keeping requirements of this patient information.
Key performance indicators

table_items.text: Number of occasions UTC pathway has to be reduced/ ceased due to physical and staffing capacity
All suitable patients should be streamed to the unit within 15 minutes of registration
All patients should be assessed by a clinician within 60 minutes
All patients should have a plan in place within 120 minutes
All patients should be admitted or discharged within 240 minutes
Number of patients seen by primary care clinicians per hour
Number of patients re-attending the ED following review and discharge by UTC with the same presenting condition within 7 days
Number of patients returned to ED pathway following assessment by UTC clinician

data.text: Equipment
The UTC will have access to the following equipment:
Crash trolley - checked on daily basis (Portable suction and oxygen will be available on the crash trolleys within the unit)
ECG machine
Dynamaps
Tympanic
Urine analysis machine
Pregnancy testing machine
Cannulation and venepuncture requirements
Snell's chart
Otoscope
Security
An intercom system will be utilised with entry restricted to only patients and their carers.
All staff working in the unit will have trust photo ID badges on them at all times.
Separate waiting rooms will be provided for the safe care of both paediatric and adults patients within a shared unit.
Patients who are displaying acutely disturbed behaviours, intoxicated or mental health presentation will not be streamed to the unit.
Trust security can be alerted at any time to support with security concerns by dialling 6666 (Mid), 3333( SH)
Panic alarms are situated in all consulting rooms and at the reception desk, which provide an immediate alert to the security team that assistance is required.
Daily checks of all panic and alarm buttons will be undertaken.
Training requirements
Outline training requirements or if not appropriate state:
No specific training requirements.
Monitoring and audit
Outlined below is the Trust's process of monitoring compliance with, and the effectiveness of the document's main points.

table_items.text: Aspect of compliance or effectiveness being monitored
Individual department responsible for the monitoring
Group / Committee / forum which will receive the findings/monitoring report
Committee / individual responsible for ensuring the actions are completed
Author to complete table in full e.g. Duties relating to repair and maintenance

data.text: Regular service reviews undertaken by Lead ENP, Paediatric ED Lead, ED Consultant Clinical Lead, Head of Nursing and Quality for Children & Young People and Service Manager to ensure the service safely and effectively meets the needs of the service users.
Monthly documentation audits undertaken by the ENP team.
CCG to actively monitor and undertake audits of the GP staff working within the unit, discussing issues or concerns during twice weekly meetings with service manager of ED.
All X-rays reviewed though the trusts radiology reporting system, with abnormal x-rays- highlighted and reviewed by an ED Consultant to ensure patient receives correct management plan.
Any reported adverse events through the trust DATIX, complaints and SI processes
Staff feedback
Approval and implementation

All policies, procedures and guidelines will be approved by the MSE Emergency Care Group which is the specialist group with the authority to approve local policies and guidelines. These will then be forwarded to the Document control team for submission and ratification by the Joint Document Management Group.
It is the author's responsibility to inform the relevant staff of the approved policy documents when they are uploaded to the Trust's Intranets.
Equality impact assessment
The Trust is committed to the provision of a service that is fair, accessible and meets the needs of all individuals.
(Refer to appendix 6)
References

London and South East England Burn Network (LSEBN). 2015. Burn Referral Guidelines: Criteria for Referral. Available at: https://www.lsebn.nhs.uk/website/X13911/files/LSEBN%20Burns%20Referral%20C riteria.pdf
National Institute for health and Care Excellence [NICE]. 2019. Head injury: assessment and early management. Clinical Guideline [CG176]. Available at: https://www.nice.org.uk/Guidance/CG176

Appendix 2: Exclusion criteria (adults)
Acute urgent safeguarding concerns
NEWS2 2 or above or Manchester Triage Category 1,2 or 3(Red/Amber/Yellow). There can be exceptions. Triage nurse to use her/his clinical judgement.
All mental health related presentations
Likely requiring blood tests
Burns not classed as minor/meeting LSEBN referral criteria
Neck/ back or chest injuries requiring imaging
Suspicion of hip injury/pathology
Requiring CT or other imaging not undertaken by ENP or ECP's
Injuries with significant deformity
Intoxicated
Re-attenders within 72 hours with same presentation
Patients that fulfil criteria for SDEC Pathway
Social issues
Head injuries meeting CT guidelines (NICE, 2019)

Acute urgent safeguarding concerns- i.e. suspected NAI

Children with respiratory distress

☐ A change to an existing document
☐ A change to the way staff work
What are you proposing to change?
Relocation of GP and ENP services to a dedicated area
Why are you making this change? (What will the change achieve?)
To create a urgent treatment centre at Broomfield site to support the emergency department
Who benefits from this change and how?
Patients and staff by streaming patients to the appropriate pathway and at the same time reduce crowding in the emergency department
Is anyone likely to suffer any negative impact as a result of this change? If no, please record reasons here and sign and date this assessment. If yes, please complete a full EIA.
a) Will you be undertaking any consultation as part of this change?
